item.title: Have we had enough of Netflix?
item.description: The streaming giant is losing subscribers despite huge hits like Squid Game and Bridgerton.

item.title: Tom Grennan recovering after NYC attack
item.description: The singer was left with a torn ear drum after being attacked outside a bar in New York this week.

item.title: Heartstopper: Teen LGBTQ+ Netflix drama pushing the envelope
item.description: Stars of Alice Oseman's TV adaptation discuss TikTok, bullying, inclusivity and mental health.

item.title: RSC artistic director to step down after 10 years
item.description: Gregory Doran is praised for his "extraordinary contribution" during his 35 years with the company.

item.title: Kardashians deny faking Roblox sex tape scene
item.description: Questions are being asked about a scene in The Kardashians, when Kim's son finds a sex tape ad on Roblox.

item.title: Johnny Depp and Amber Heard face off in court
item.description: Depp says she stubbed a cigarette on his face. The court sees a Depp text saying: "Lets burn Amber!!!"

item.title: CNN streaming service to shut a month after launch
item.description: It comes as Netflix has reported a plunge in subscribers in the face of stiff competition from rivals.

item.title: TikTok helps UK book sales hit record levels, Publishers Association says
item.description: Publishers say the popularity of book videos on TikTok helped lift sales to record numbers in 2021.

item.title: Tom Parker: Fans say emotional farewell at The Wanted singer's funeral
item.description: Hundreds gather outside the funeral of The Wanted singer, who died last month at the age of 33.

item.title: Happening director Audrey Diwan says abortion should not be 'a silent topic'
item.description: Award-winning director Audrey Diwan talks about how her own abortion led her to make her new film.

item.title: 'People fear for their jobs if they report bullies'
item.description: Bafta-winning director Brian Hill on tackling bullying in his industry with new film Toxic.

item.title: KGF 2, RRR, Pushpa: The southern Indian films winning on Bollywood's turf
item.description: The recent theatrical success of movies like KGF 2 and RRR has revived a debate on the "pan-Indian" film.

item.title: Shark Tank: India TV show proves entrepreneurship isn't just for rich
item.description: Shark Tank India featured 67 ideas on which investors spent more than 400m rupees.

item.title: Homophobic slur prompts Wales Millennium Centre show
item.description: Luke Hereford says his grandmother Joan encouraged him to be himself by dressing up in her clothes.

item.title: Michael Sheen mural part of Port Talbot street art promo
item.description: A new initiative aims to make Port Talbot a "street art capital" in the UK with a series of murals.

item.title: Omid Djalili: Clever comedians can navigate cancel culture
item.description: The comedian says he has never done more set-up and explanation of jokes to prevent “cancellation”.

item.title: Britney Spears: Sam Asghari talks marriage and family plans with singer
item.description: In an Oscars week interview, the actor said marriage and kids should've happened 'three years ago'.

item.title: Saniya Mistri: The hijab-wearing teen rapper breaking stereotypes
item.description: Saniya Mistri's powerful rap songs call out the glaring inequalities in her city, Mumbai.

item.title: Inside London's only pointe shoes factory
item.description: The craft of making pointe shoes for ballet dancers has recently been put on the heritage craft red list.

item.title: Ashanti: R&B singer's mum reveals 20-year-old souvenir star at Hollywood ceremony
item.description: Ashanti's mum says she bought a fake star for her daughter 20 years ago, as R&B star gets real deal.
